results.definition: lay aside, abandon, or leave for another
examples: switch to a different brand of beer

results.definition: control consisting of a mechanical or electrical or electronic device for making or breaking or changing the connections in a circuit
reverse (a direction, attitude, or course of action)
cause to go on or to be engaged or set in operation
the act of changing one thing or position for another
examples: his switch on abortion cost him the election

results.definition: an event in which one thing is substituted for another
make a shift in or exchange of
examples: First Joe led; then we switched

results.definition: exchange or give (something) in exchange for
change over, change around, as to a new order or sequence
a basketball maneuver; two defensive players shift assignments so that each guards the player usually guarded by the other
a flexible implement used as an instrument of punishment
flog with or as if with a flexible rod
hairpiece consisting of a tress of false hair; used by women to give shape to a coiffure
railroad track having two movable rails and necessary connections; used to turn a train from one track to another or to store rolling stock
